snippet: The Santa Clara Valley Medical Center in San Jose, Calif., said it had identified all the people potentially exposed and was contacting them.
abstract: Nurse diagnosed with tuberculosis comes in contact with over 1,000 people, including 350 infants, while working at Santa Clara Valley Medical Center in San Jose, Calif; hospital officials are contacting each person at risk of exposure and offering preventive treatment, but so far no one has tested positive.
lead_paragraph: The Santa Clara Valley Medical Center in San Jose, Calif., said it had identified all the people potentially exposed and was contacting them.

headline.main: Nurse With Tuberculosis May Have Exposed Over 1,000, Including 350 Infants
headline.print_headline: Nurse With Tuberculosis May Have Exposed 1,000

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
